entry.title: Armenia approves increase in military spending

media:group.media:title: Armenia approves increase in military spending
media:group.media:description:
๐ Armeniaโs parliament passed the state budget for 2025, which sees a significant increase in military spending. The countryโs opposition voted against the bill. ๐ The World Bank Group released a comprehensive climate and development report on Armenia, revealing the nation's intricate challenges in greenhouse gas emissions, energy security, and environmental sustainability. ๐ Armeniaโs ruling Civil Contract party announced seven candidates for the mayoral primaries in Gyumri, the countryโs second-largest city. The list includes a relative of Anna Hakobyan, the wife of Armeniaโs Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan. ๐ How the ICC warrant for Netanyahu empowers Armenia against Aliyev: https://youtu.be/iQ3JBH6fdEs?si=xg314dw58CUer8l7

ยฉ ีีตีธึีฉีซ ีฐีฅีฒีซีถีกีฏีกีตีซีถ ีซึีกีพีธึีถึีถีฅึีจ ีบีกีฟีฏีกีถีธึีด ีฅีถ ีีซีพีซีฌีซีฉีกีฝ ีฐีซีดีถีกีคึีกีดีซีถ: ีีซีพีซีฌีีฅีฉีซ ีญีดีขีกีฃึีกีฏีกีถ ึีกีฒีกึีกีฏีกีถีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีฐีกีดีกีฑีกีตีถ` ีกึีฃีฅีฌีพีธึีด ีง ึ ีฃีฟีกีฃีธึีฎีฅีฌ ีีซีพีซีฌีีฅีฉีซ ีถีตีธึีฉีฅึีจ ีกีผีกีถึ ีบีกีฟีทีกีณ ีฐีฒีดีกีถ, ีถีฅึีขีฅีผีถีฅีฌ ึ ีกีตีฌ ึ ีถีฌีกีตีถ ีฐีกึีฉีกีฏีซึ ีพีฅึีขีฅีผีถีฅีฌ ีีซีพีซีฌีีฅีฉีซ ีบีกีฟึีกีฝีฟีกีฎ ึ ีฟีกึีขีฅึีกีถีทีกีถีจ ีฏึีธีฒ ีฟีฅีฝีกีถีตีธึีฉีฅึีจ` ีกีผีกีถึ ีฐีกีดีกีบีกีฟีกีฝีญีกีถ ีฐีกีดีกีฑีกีตีถีธึีฉีตีกีถ:

entry.title: ิฑีถีฏีกีญีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีฐีผีนีกีฏีกีฃึีซ ึ ีีกีฐีดีกีถีกีคึีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีฅึีฏีพีธึีฉีตีธึีถีจ ีพีฟีกีถีฃีกีพีธึ ีง. ีิด ีถีกีญีกีฃีกีฐ

media:group.media:title: ิฑีถีฏีกีญีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีฐีผีนีกีฏีกีฃึีซ ึ ีีกีฐีดีกีถีกีคึีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีฅึีฏีพีธึีฉีตีธึีถีจ ีพีฟีกีถีฃีกีพีธึ ีง. ีิด ีถีกีญีกีฃีกีฐ
media:group.media:description:
ีีกีฐีดีกีถีกีคึีกีฏีกีถ ีคีกีฟีกึีกีถีซ ีถีกีญีกีฃีกีฐ ิฑึีดีกีถ ิดีซีฌีกีถีตีกีถีจ ีีซีพีซีฌีีฅีฉีซ ิฑึีทีกีฌีธึีตีฝ ีีฒีคีฅีฝีตีกีถีซ ีฐีฅีฟ ีฆึีธึีตึีธึีด ีบีกึีฆีกีขีกีถีฅีฌ ีง ีิด ีพีฅึีปีซีถ ีธึีธีทีธึีดีจ, ีธึีธีพ ีฐีฝีฟีกีฏีฅึีพีฅีฌ ีง ีีกีฐีดีกีถีกีคึีธึีฉีตีกีถ ึ ิฑีถีฏีกีญีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีฐีผีนีกีฏีกีฃึีซ ีฐีกึีกีขีฅึีกีฏึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีจ: ิดีซีฌีกีถีตีกีถีซ ีญีธีฝึีธีพี ีกีตีฝ ีธึีธีทีดีกีดีข ีฝีกีฐีดีกีถีกีฆีกีฟีพีฅีฌ ีง ีีกีฐีดีกีถีกีคึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีจ. ีคึีก ีกีถีฐึีกีชีฅีทีฟีธึีฉีตีธึีถีจ ีบีกีตีดีกีถีกีพีธึีพีกีฎ ีงึ ีฅึีฏีธึ ีฐีซีดีถีกึีกึ ึีกีฝีฟีกีฉีฒีฉีฅึีซ ีดีซีปึ ีกีผีฏีก ีซึีกีพีกีฏีกีถ ีฅึีฏีพีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีพีฅึีกึีดีกีถ ีฐึีกีฟีกีบีธึีฉีตีกีดีข:
ีีกึึีกีฆึีธึีตึีซ ีจีถีฉีกึึีธึีด ีิด ีถีกีญีกีฃีกีฐีถ ีกีถีคึีกีคีกึีฑีฅีฌ ีง ีถีกึ ีฐีกีถึีกีตีซีถ ีดีฅีฎ ีฐีฅีฟีกึึึึีธึีฉีตีธึีถ ีถีฅึีฏีกีตีกึีถีธีฒ ีดีฅีฏ ีกีตีฌ ีฉีฅีดีกีตีซี ีกีบึ ึีซีถีซ ีฃีธึีตึีซ ีขีผีถีกีฃีกีถีฑีดีกีถ ึ ึีฅีถีฝีคึีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีพีฅึีกีขีฅึีตีกีฌ ีคีซีดีธึีดีซ ึีถีถีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีฑีฃีฑีฃีดีกีถ ีบีกีฟีณีกีผีถีฅึีซีถ: ีีก ีถีกึ ีญีธีฝีฅีฌ ีง ีคีกีฟีกีฏีกีถ ีซีทีญีกีถีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีกีถีฏีกีญีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีกีดึีกีบีถีคีดีกีถ ีฐึีกีฟีกีบ ีญีถีคีซึีถีฅึีซ ึ ีคึีกีถึ ีฌีธึีฎีดีกีถ ีฐีถีกึีกีพีธึ ีธึีฒีซีถีฅึีซ ีดีกีฝีซีถ:
0:00 - ีิด-ีถ ีฝีกีฐีดีกีถีกีฆีกีฟีฅีฌ ีง ีีกีฐีดีกีถีกีคึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีจ 3:57 - ิปีถีนีธีึ ีง ีิด-ีถ ึีถีถีฅีฌ ีีกีฐีดีกีถีกีคึีธึีฉีตีกีถ ึ ิฑีถีฏีกีญีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีฐีผีนีกีฏีกีฃึีซ ีกีผีถีนีธึีฉีตีธึีถีจ 9:03 - ีิด-ีถ ีกึีชีฅีฆึีฏีฅีีฌ ีง ิฑีถีฏีกีญีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีฐีผีนีกีฏีกีฃึีซ ีถีธึีดีกีฟีซีพีกีตีซีถ ีถีทีกีถีกีฏีธึีฉีตีธึีถีจ 12:24 - ีีผีนีกีฏีกีฃีซึีจ ีถีธึีดีกีฟีซีพีกีตีซีีถ, ีฉีฅี ีบีกีฟีดีกีฏีกีถ ึีกีฝีฟีกีฉีธึีฒีฉ ีง 13:57 - ยซิตีฝ ีกีตีฌ ีซึีกีพีซีณีกีฏีถีฅึีธึีด ีงีฌ ีถีธึีตีถ ีฑึ ีฏึีพีฅีกึีฏีฅีซยป 16:52 - ีีซ ีฅีฒีฅีฌ ีคีฅีบึ, ีธึ ีิด-ีถ ีกีดีขีธีฒีป ีฎีกีพีกีฌีธีพ ีคีซีฟีกึีฏีซ ีีกีฐีดีกีถีกีคึีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีดีกีฝ 26:29 - ีีซีปีกีฆีฃีกีตีซีถ ึึีฅีกีฏีกีถ ีคีกีฟีกึีกีถีซีถ ีดีซีกีถีกีฌีธึ ีดีกีฝีซีถ 31:32 - ิตีฉีฅ ีีธึีฟีซีถีจ ีฃีก ีีกีตีกีฝีฟีกีถ, ีถึีกีถ ีฏีฑีฅึีขีกีฏีกีฌีฅีีถ 34:40 - ีีกีตีกีฝีฟีกีถีจ ีฏีกึีธีีฒ ีง ีีซีปีกีฆีฃีกีตีซีถ ึึีฅีกีฏีกีถ ีคีกีฟีกึีกีถีซ ีธึีธีทีธึีดีจ ีนีฏีกีฟีกึีฅีฌ 36:24 - ิฑีบึ ึีซีถีซ ีฃีธึีตึีซ ีขีผีถีกีฃีกีถีฑีดีกีถ ึ ึีฅีถึีซ ีพีฅึีกีขีฅึีตีกีฌ ีคีซีดีธึีดีซ ึีถีถีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีฑีฃีฑีฃีดีกีถ ีดีกีฝีซีถ 40:53 - ิตีฉีฅ ีิด-ีถ ีณีกีถีกีนีซ ิฑีบึ ึีซีถีซ ีฃีธึีตึีซ ีขีผีถีกีฃีกีถีฑีดีกีถ ีดีกีฝีซีถ ึ ึีฅีถึีจ ีฐีกีฏีกีฝีกีฐีดีกีถีกีคึีกีฏีกีถโฆ 41:34 - ิฟีกึีฅีถ ิฑีถีคึีฅีกีฝีตีกีถีซ ีฐึีกีชีกึีกีฏีกีถีซ ึ ีคีกีฟีกีฏีกีถ ีซีทีญีกีถีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีกีถีฏีกีญีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีดีกีฝีซีถ 45:00 - ิฑีถีฏีกีีญ ีง ีกึีคีตีธึ ีคีกีฟีกีฏีกีถ ีซีทีญีกีถีธึีฉีตีธึีถีจ

entry.title: โI try to seize every opportunity as a gift to do good,โ Tatev Petrossian

media:group.media:title: โI try to seize every opportunity as a gift to do good,โ Tatev Petrossian
media:group.media:description:
Todayโs guest on Mindful Leaders is Tatev Petrossian, an inspiring designer, entrepreneur, and a visionary. Born to Armenian parents and raised in France, Tatevโs deep ancestral connection to the regions of Mush, Sasun, Van, and Yegheknadzor has shapedf her life journey. After working in financial and strategy management, Tatev founded Revolve Consulting, a company centred on design thinking and the circular economy. However, the war in Artsakh triggered a powerful transformation in her life. Confronting pain and loss, she found strength and channelled her emotions into a driving force for change. This shift led her to design with a deeper, purpose-driven focus. In 2022, Tatev and her sister Emma founded Atelier79, a French-Armenian fine jewellery studio that challenges traditional norms by infusing each unique piece with rich stories. This episode delves into Tatevโs passion for creativity and innovation. We discuss how she has used her entrepreneurial journey to create design spaces encouraging mindfulness, meaning, and compassion. Through her work, Tatev reminds us that despite lifeโs challenges, we always have the choice to pursue endeavours with purpose, vision, and consciousness.
About Tatev Petrossian Tatev Petrossian is the co-founder of Atelier79, a French-Armenian fine jewellery studio. Born in Yerevan, Petrossian grew up in Nice and moved to Paris to study at the Grande Ecole of INSEEC. She then started her career in private equity investment, working on the Caucasian portfolio of an alternative assets fund based in Paris. Tatev navigated through various positions to become a consultant and advisor to different businesses in London and Moscow. She completed her second Masterโs degree at the Russian Presidential Academy of National Economy and Public Administration in Moscow. In 2018, Petrossian returned to Armenia and founded Revolve Consulting, a firm committed to raising awareness of alternative business models, notably design thinking and the circular economy. In 2021, Petrossian took a leap of faith and started Atelier79 with her sister Emma โ a fine jewellery studio. This new entrepreneurial path combined her years of experience in strategy and design thinking with the world of fine jewellery design. Driven by her passion for fine jewellery and her purpose to set a new standard for what French-Armenian fusion can represent, she leads Atelier79 as the head designer of both the brandโs collections and the bespoke co-design studio service.
Program Overview Mindful Leaders dives into the stories of people who have achieved prominence, walked incredible journeys, and have defined culture.
Lara sits down with specialists, thinkers, and change catalysts to deconstruct insights, events, and lessons that have shaped their personal and professional lives and have enabled them to create meaning and connection.
0:00 Introduction 1:16 Childhood, from Armenia to France 4:26 Ancestry and descendant of strong women 7:14 Multiple talents, portfolio careers, and making conscious choices 13:47 Finding purpose after the war and loss of Artsakh 16:15 The birth and intention of Atelier79 20:27 The stories behind each Atelier79 piece 21:48 Design thinking and conscious capitalism 29:35 Navigating collective emotions and hope for the future

media:group.media:title: Visaโs vision for business and economic development in Armenia
media:group.media:description:
Partner content
In this interview, Diana Kiguradze, Visa's Regional Manager for the Caucasus, provides a comprehensive overview of the company's strategy and achievements in driving the growth of digital finance in Georgia and Armenia. Drawing on her experience spearheading Visa's agenda in this dynamic region, Kiguradze shares insights into the unique opportunities and obstacles faced in expanding electronic payments infrastructure, fostering financial inclusion, and adapting global solutions to local market dynamics.

ิฑีทีธีฟ ิฒีฅีฃีฌีกึีตีกีถีจ ีีฟีฅึีกีถีกีฏีฅึีฟีซ ีขีฅีถีฆีซีถีซ ีบีกีฐีฅีฝีฟีซ ีบีกีตีฉีตีธึีถีซ ีชีกีดีกีถีกีฏ ีง ีพีซึีกีพีธึีพีฅีฌึ 91 ีฟีธีฏีธีฝ ีญีธึีจ ีพีถีกีฝีพีกีฎึีถีฅึีธีพ ีฟีฅีฒีกึีธีญีพีฅีฌ ีง ิตึึีกีถีซ ิฑีตึีพีกีฎึีกีขีกีถีธึีฉีตีกีถ ีฏีฅีถีฟึีธีถ, ีธึีฟีฅีฒ ีฑีกีญ ีธีฟึีถ ีธึ ีฑีฅีผึีซ ีดีกีฟีถีฅึีถ ีกีดีบีธึีฟีกึึีฅีฌ ีฅีถึ ิฑีทีธีฟีถ ีธึ ีฏีซีถีจ ีบีกีฟีดีธึีด ีฅีถ, ีฉีฅ ีซีถีน ีคีชีพีกึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅึีซ ีฅีถ ีฐีกีถีคีซีบีธึีด ีธึ ีซีถีนีบีฅีฝ ีฅีถ ึีธึีฑีธึีด ีคึีกีถึ ีฐีกีฒีฉีกีฐีกึีฅีฌึ ีีธึีถีพีกึีซึ ิฑีทีธีฟีจ ีฏีทีกึีธึีถีกีฏีซ ีพีฅึีกีฏีกีถีฃีถีธีฒีกีฏีกีถ ีฏีธึึีฝีจ ิถีซีถีพีธึีซ ีฟีกีถีจึ ีีธึีตีฝ ีธึีถีซ, ีธึ ีฐีฅีฟีกีฃีกีตีธึีด ีฏีฏีกึีธีฒีกีถีก ีบึีธีฉีฅีฆีซ ีดีซีปีธึีธีพ ึีกีตีฌีฅีฌึ
